alert.note: Alert for Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 4:08PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, EAST CENTRAL RIPLEY, DEARBORN, NORTHERN BOONE AND WEST CENTRAL HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 408 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles northeast of Moores Hill, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Harrison, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Bright, Hidden Valley, Cleves, Shawnee, Moores Hill, Miami Heights, Blue Jay, Mack, Guilford, Wilmington, Logan, Manchester, Grandview, French, Sunman, and Addyston. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 159 and 168. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 5 and 8, and near mile marker 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
